;;

;

;The price adjustment effect is immediate. Take Coca-Cola as an example. In the second quarter of 2023, Coca-Cola's revenue increased by 6% year-on-year, exceeding expectations. The important reason is that the price of Coca-Cola increased by 10% compared with the same period in 2022. Visual China | Picture

;

;Beverages are bidding farewell to the "Three Yuan Era".

;

;Starting from November 2023, Master Kong's beverage prices will increase across the board - the retail price of packaging of Master Kong's tea and juice series products will be adjusted from 3 yuan/bottle to 3.5 yuan/bottle bottle, the retail price of 1L bottle is adjusted from 4 yuan/bottle to 5 yuan/bottle.

;

;Master Kong iced black tea is favored by users because of its low price and high cost performance. Master Kong’s customer service stated that the price increase was due to rising raw material and labor costs, and that retail prices across the country will be adjusted uniformly.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters found that the prices of two sizes of iced black tea in many Wumart supermarkets in Beijing have been consistent with the price adjustment notice. The prices in convenience stores such as Lawson are slightly higher. The 500ml package sells for 4 yuan. The price in online channels is slightly lower, but it is also higher than before. The price of 12 bottles of 1L iced black tea sold in Tingyi Tmall flagship store is 54.9 yuan, which is about 4.6 yuan per bottle.

;

;In fact, Master Kong is already a latecomer to price adjustments, and this wave of beverage price increases has already begun in the second half of 2022. In February 2023, Nongfu Spring announced that it would adjust the price of 19L bottled water in Hangzhou by 2 yuan, and Yakult also announced that the unit price of original products would increase from 11.7 yuan to 12.8 yuan.

;

;Historically, this is the fifth wave of price increases in the beverage industry. Since 2006, the domestic food and beverage industry has experienced four price increases, namely in 2010, 2012, 2017, and 2021.

;

;The effect of price adjustment is immediate. Take Coca-Cola as an example. In the second quarter of 2023, Coca-Cola's revenue increased by 6% year-on-year, exceeding expectations. The important reason is that the price of Coca-Cola increased by 10% compared with the same period in 2022. It is against this background that Coca-Cola President and Chief Financial Officer John Murphy said that Coca-Cola will continue to increase prices in the second half of 2023.

;

;"Beverage companies are all under pressure from operating data." Zhang Yi, chief analyst of iiMedia Consulting, pointed out to Southern Weekend reporters that there will naturally be comparisons when beverages are sold at low prices. Good sales data, but profits are relatively disproportionate, so companies need to raise prices to increase profits in financial reports. This is the "most direct way."

;

;Sugar prices continue to rise

;

;Li Yingtao, a partner of Analysys Analysis and Consulting, told Southern Weekend reporters that the rise in sugar prices and packaging bottle raw material prices is the reason for this increase. The reason for the price increase of beverages “is the result of transmission throughout the industry chain.” A Haitong Securities research report shows that among the costs of the soft drink industry, manufacturing and labor on the raw material side account for 20%, white sugar accounts for 15%, and fruit juice accounts for 10%.

;

;Food and beverage marketing expert Yu Runjie told Southern Weekend reporters that in the past, white sugar accounted for 20%-30% of the total cost of beverages, but now many companies choose sweetened sugar. Flavoring agents are used to replace or partially replace white sugar, resulting in a reduction in the proportion of white sugar in costs and a reduction in the correlation between beverage prices and sugar prices. "Of course, the prices of beverage brands and products that still insist on using white sugar will still be greatly affected by rising sugar prices."

;

;For the food and beverage industry , The price increase chain is generally transmitted from global commodity price increases to domestic bulk raw materials, then to the manufacturing industry, and then to midstream consumer goods companies, and finally downstream consumers feel the price increases.

;

;Data released by the China Sugar Association in October 2023 show that in the 2022/23 sugar production period, the country will produce a total of 8.97 million tons of sugar, a year-on-year decrease of 590,000 tons. . The cumulative average sales price of finished white sugar by sugar industry enterprises across the country is 6,270 yuan/ton, a year-on-year increase of 516 yuan/ton. The average sales price of finished white sugar in August was as high as 7,035 yuan/ton, while in August 2022 the price was only 5,747 yuan/ton.

;

;The main sources of sugar production are sugar cane and beets, of which sugar cane sugar accounts for 80%. Due to climate problems such as drought, sugarcane production will drop significantly worldwide in 2023.

;

;This is the case with India, the largest sugar producer. Zhang Yi pointed out that under the influence of geopolitics, energy prices have risen, and more sugar has been used as biofuel. India plans to use 4.5 million to 5 million tons of sugar cane required for sugar production to produce ethanol, which will also occupy part of the sugar cane supply and affect India's sugar production.

;

;It is against this background that, according to CCTV news reports, India announced a ban on sugar exports starting in October in response to domestic sugarcane production reductions due to climate change. Sugar supply is tight and prices are soaring.

;

;Sugar substitute products are also rising in price

;

;It’s not just sugary drinks. Southern Weekend reporters found that in this round of price increases, The prices of some sugar-free drinks have also increased.

;

;For example, starting from January 2023, Yakult not only increased the price of the regular version, but also the low-sugar version with sucralose. It was adjusted from 12.7 yuan to 13.8 yuan, an increase of about 8.6%, which is equivalent to the regular version. In addition, Suntory's sugar-free oolong tea and sugar-free version of Vitasoy have also raised prices one after another, by about 1 yuan.

;

;Currently, sugar substitute products used in beverages include aspartame, sucralose, erythritol, etc.

;

;The September price adjustment letter from the sugar substitute manufacturer Kangbao Biochemical shows that the price of sucralose products has been adjusted to 180 yuan/kg for large packages and 182 yuan/kg for small packages. Kilogram, it was previously 140 yuan/kg; another company, Jinhe Industrial, adjusted its price twice in a row in September. After the price of sucralose increased from 138,000/ton to 150,000/ton, it was adjusted to 180,000/ton. According to data from Haitong International, the market price of acesulfame potassium also rose from 38,000 yuan/ton to 48,000 yuan/ton in September.

;

;The increase in the price of sugar substitute products is related to the increase in their raw materials. Herbalife Biochemical pointed out in the price adjustment letter that the price of DMF, the main raw material for glycerol production, has increased by nearly 7,000 yuan/ton, acetic acid has increased by nearly 2,000 yuan/ton, white sugar has increased by nearly 1,000 yuan/ton, sulfoxide chloride and other The price of raw materials generally increased by 300-800 yuan per ton, and all raw materials continued to rise.

;

;In addition to the impact of rising raw material prices, sugar substitute product manufacturers also attribute the increase in sucralose production costs to the approaching heating season, raw material transportation costs, steam energy Consumption costs continue to increase.

;

;At present, not only upstart beverage companies like Yuanqi Forest, but also traditional beverage manufacturers such as Master Kong and Nongfu Spring have launched sugar-free products to seize the market. Coca-Cola's annual report shows that the sales growth rate of sugar-free Coca-Cola in 2022 will reach 11%, which is much higher than the regular version of Coca-Cola.

;

;Based on this, Yu Runjie believes that after the price of sugar rises, many companies will choose to replace sugar with lower-cost sugar substitute products, especially in the " In the "zero sugar" trend, more companies are choosing sugar substitute products, which will also lead to a rapid increase in demand for sugar substitute products and an increase in the price of sugar substitute products.

;

;;

;

;COFCO Sugar stated in the minutes of the investor exchange meeting disclosed on November 1, 2023 that the current domestic and foreign sugar prices are at historically high levels, and are generally expected to remain high next year. There is a gap between supply and demand, and sugar prices are likely to remain high. Visual China | Picture

;

;The leader takes the lead in raising prices, and competing products follow up in 3-6 months

;

;Generally speaking, based on market competition Considering that in the face of high-priced raw materials, downstream beverage manufacturers maintain a wait-and-see attitude and choose to postpone the replenishment of sugar stocks or maintain costs through other means.

;

;For example, Guangzhou Langqi stated in its reply to investors that Huatang Food, a subsidiary that operates refined sugar and beverage businesses, carries out arbitrage in white sugar futures and white sugar options. The long-term hedging business effectively avoids and reduces operating risks caused by fluctuations in raw material prices and ensures the relative stability of product costs.

;

;However, the continued rise in sugar prices has not stopped. COFCO Sugar stated in the investor exchange meeting minutes disclosed on November 1 that the current domestic and international sugar prices are at historically high levels. It is generally expected that there will still be a supply and demand gap next year, and sugar prices are likely to remain high. Suntory said in the price increase notice that the company has hedged against the increased costs through internal operating cost optimization and other measures. However, the current cost increase "has reached the limit that our company can bear."

;

;Manufacturers will also observe the choices of competitors. "If the leading company does not raise prices, it will basically be more difficult for other companies to raise prices, or they will simply not dare to raise prices." Li Yingtao said.

;

;Take Master Kong as an example. This round of price increases starting in the second half of 2022 has given it enough confidence. Tingyi's previous financial report was not good-looking. Goldman Sachs also lowered Tingyi's sales forecast for the second half of the year in October 2023. Tingyi urgently needs to break the current situation of "increasing revenue without increasing profits".

;

;Of course, the timing of price increases is also a consideration. Beverage price increases are usually carried out in the fourth quarter, the off-season sales season. A beverage distributor told Southern Weekend reporters that it would take 1-2 months for price increases to be transmitted to the sales terminal market, and requested that promotion activities be reduced.

;

;Yu Runjie said that during the peak beverage sales season from May to September, dealers and channels have more goods. If the price is adjusted at this time, firstly, it will easily lead to The second reason is that the market mixes goods and the channels have random prices, which have a greater impact on sales. Adjusting prices after the peak sales season is over can minimize the impact.

;

;A research report from Ping An Securities also shows that price increases usually occur after 1-2 quarters of rising raw material costs, with leading companies taking the lead in raising prices. Other competing products will follow in about 3-6 months.

;

;Use price increases to increase channel profits?

;

;The exact same drink is more expensive to buy in convenience stores than in large supermarkets, and large supermarkets are often more expensive than online channels. This is because of the price increases in different channels. different.

;

;Beverage price increases generally include increases at two levels - an increase in factory ex-factory prices and an increase in terminal sales prices, both of which usually occur at the same time. In addition to rising production costs, channel profits are also an important factor affecting price increases.

;

;Li Yingtao said that channel distribution fees are also the main cost of beverages, accounting for about 20%. In addition, dealers and agents at all levels in provinces, cities and counties play a major role. Cost also accounts for about 10%.

;

;In supermarket containers, the price of a wide range of beverages is generally above 5 yuan, and the price that dealers are willing to pay for these high-priced beverages is generally higher. Currently, channel push is still an important force in the sales growth of FMCG, especially new beverage brands.

;

;Yu Runjie believes that the increase in beverage prices not only increases costs, but also increases channel profits through price increases, so as to improve the channel and The competitiveness of terminal stores. Vitasoy directly pointed out in the price adjustment notice that while the price adjustment is being made, it will "reasonably increase channel gross profit and bring better sales profits to customers."

;

;"Personally, I don’t think that the new beverage brands with higher prices on the market are more high-end in terms of product content, but they just bring more profits to the channel than traditional beverage brands. It's just higher, which leads to higher selling prices." Yu Runjie believes that after the price increase of traditional beverages such as Master Kong, the profits at the channel end will increase, the push of the channel will also be enhanced, and the competitiveness of new beverage brands will also be enhanced. From this perspective, price increases will not have a negative impact on sales, and may even increase sales.

;

;;

;

;On November 18, 2023, consumers were buying juice drinks in a Wumart supermarket in Beijing. Visual China | Picture

;

;“There is room for price increases in the market, which is the most important thing”

;

;On one side, beverage manufacturers are increasing prices; Consumers are looking to downgrade their spending.

;

;The "Chinese Consumer Monthly Tracking Data" released by the consulting company Mintel shows that for non-alcoholic beverages, the proportion of consumers with consumption upgrade plans has increased since 2021. It has been on a downward trend since April 2023 and reached a low of 21% in July 2023, ranking at the bottom among all food and beverage categories. At the same time, the proportion of consumers with downgrade plans increased from 11% in April 2021 to 18% in October 2023.

;

;Lu Ruixun, deputy director of food and beverage research at Mintel, told Southern Weekend reporters that this shows that even if the unit price is relatively low, consumers' spending on non-alcoholic beverages has changed. Consumers need to be more cautious as price increases may further influence consumers' purchasing decisions for non-alcoholic beverages. The more positive news is that overall consumer demand for upgrades in non-alcoholic beverages still outweighs downgrades.

;

;Aside from all the rhetoric about rising raw material prices, Zhang Yi particularly noticed that beverages such as Master Kong, Coca-Cola, and Pepsi-Cola are significantly priced compared to trendy domestic beverages. Low. "Young people can actually buy these products whose unit prices are one or two yuan higher, or even two or three yuan higher. Theoretically, there is room for price increases in the market, which is the most important thing."

;

;iiMedia data shows that soft drink consumers are mainly young people under the age of 30, and this group is generally not sensitive to price. According to its survey data, taking carbonated drinks as an example, young people’s monthly consumption expenditure on carbonated drinks between 50 yuan and 100 yuan accounts for the highest proportion, reaching 46.4%. Those priced below 50 yuan accounted for 36.5%, and those priced between 100 yuan and 300 yuan accounted for 14.5%. This shows that this group’s demand for beverages in daily consumption tends to be rigid.

;

;The data of e-commerce platforms also reflects this. Data from the consumption data platform Star Map shows that during the "Double Eleven" that just passed, online sales of food and beverages were 55.8 billion, accounting for 5.7%, an increase of 3.9 billion compared with 2022, an increase of 0.5 percentage points.

;

;However, Zhang Yi also found that consumers' brand loyalty to beverages "is generally not too fixed." The survey shows that consumers usually switch between two to three brands, accounting for 57.8%, and the proportion of consumers who are fixed on one brand is about 30%.

;

;From this perspective, affordable price tags may not be a good thing for brands. "Our survey found that consumers pay more attention to the brand and the taste of drinks than health. For example, Yuanqi Forest and some other new tea products are more expensive than Master Kong, which does not hinder consumer consumption. Brand influence and Trendiness will play a very important role," Zhang Yi said.

;;

;

;;(Picture from Honor 100 series Photography/Pictures);

;

;This is probably the busiest year for young dancer Meng Qingyang. On the stage of the 2023 Year of the Rabbit Spring Festival Gala, the dance poetry drama "Only Green" starring Meng Qingyang became popular all over the country and was well known to the public. On multiple social platforms, netizens rushed to imitate her classic dance move "green waist".

;

;Meng Qingyang is a dancer of China Oriental Performing Arts Group and has been dancing for 11 years. She has been the leading dancer in many large-scale national events and foreign affairs events. Dancers are harder to remember than film and television actors. Large-scale dances have a large number of people, a variety of formations, and are covered by makeup and costumes, so most of the dancers' faces are blurred. Now that his work has become popular, Meng Qingyang still maintains his sobriety: "I think labels are not a bad thing. They can help everyone remember the role you played and the image you created. In a few years, people may forget that Meng Qingyang played Qinglu, but they can remember It's enough to have a touch of green."

;

;On the day of the interview, Meng Qingyang performed in Huanggang, Hubei. She is tall and straight, and her dancer's temperament is fully displayed. Many people rate her as "stable", which is not only reflected in her stable dancing skills, but also her outstanding personal characteristics. Although during the interview she had to re-answer the questions she had already answered due to equipment problems, she did not show any impatience or displeasure and always kept smiling.

;

;In March 2021, in the rehearsal hall of China Oriental Performing Arts Group, the main creators talked about the fact that the entire dance drama was based on the Northern Song Dynasty's masterpiece "A Thousand Miles of Rivers and Mountains" and used this as the background to create the dance drama. Prior to this, the actors all knew that directors Zhou Liya and Han Zhen were going to produce a dance drama with our company, and everyone had made full preparations. In Meng Qingyang's view, working with two directors can improve an actor's artistic career and enhance his artistic aesthetic, so no matter what drama they collaborate on, everyone is fully committed.

;

;"Green" is a freehand character. In the dance drama, it is the scroll-roller that connects modern times, leading the audience into the landscape of the Song Dynasty. In Meng Qingyang's eyes, she is like a connector of time and space. Meng Qingyang also experienced many physical and mental twists and turns in playing such a character that has no reference to reality and is even a bit nihilistic. When she first put on the practice skirt, because it was a very long fishtail skirt, the director said that she looked like a mermaid in a wedding dress, without the simple and quiet feeling of a painting. "You have to feel like you are in this painting that lasts for nearly a thousand years, just like the scene where people in our century see the picture of mountains and rivers thousands of miles away." Through the guidance of the two directors, Meng Qingyang found the direction little by little. and grippers.

;

;To create a character, a dancer must first understand the cultural value and connotation behind it. In addition to directing, Meng Qingyang also learned a lot about the art of the Northern Song Dynasty, and went to the Palace Museum to see the working scenes of cultural workers, such as how to restore a painting bit by bit. A painting may need to be restored for several months or even longer. This spirit of devoting himself wholeheartedly to cultural and cultural undertakings made Meng Qingyang feel a certain kind of "immersion and tranquility". The creative team also invited a number of intangible cultural heritage experts to explain the selection of silk and pigments in "A Thousand Miles of Rivers and Mountains". Every detail contains rich cultural significance. Only by comprehensively grasping the various aspects of that era can we shape the characters for the actors. Add a little "realness" to the character.

;

;At first, Meng Qingyang felt that standing there did not look like the person in the scroll that had been sealed in the museum for thousands of years. However, after a long period of immersion and learning, it was a "sudden enlightenment" when she really knew how to play this role. "All of a sudden, it lights up your nerves and makes you catch Qinglu." When playing the role of Qinglu seriously, Meng Qingyang found that Qinglu also had a special persistence to work hard. That persistence seemed to guide her to the studio and pick up the strokes. Like "A Thousand Miles of Rivers and Mountains", she had pictures and infinite reveries in her mind. At that moment, she was green, and green was her.

;

;Immersive encounter with characters

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;; Qinglu is a freehand character. What qualities did you capture to express this character? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;The character Qinglu is almost always looking down. When a dancer stands on the stage, the body is the first way to output emotions, and the second is the eyes. But this character lowers his eyes, and there is a sense of alienation as the audience said, and that sense of alienation is very quiet and mysterious. It's an oriental aesthetic, so it's quite difficult to grasp this role. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Remember which node you thought you found Qinglu Yet? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;At the beginning of the play, the stage design had a large scroll, and I was standing in the scroll. When the music started, the scroll slowly opened, and a very cold light shone on Qinglu. At that moment, she stood there like a scroll that had been sealed for thousands of years. When she moves, the entire space-time scroll moves with it, and then our modern scroll unfolder comes out. At that moment, it is like a human emotion that has been sealed for thousands of years and can only be generated when it moves. I would imagine that my body went from pale to filled with red blood, and gradually gained warmth and human emotions. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Do you think Green will be the most satisfying to you? Works? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang:;;So far, I can say that it is my most satisfying work. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;If you choose three keywords to describe yourself, Which three would you choose? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;The first thing I would choose is freedom, because I think I am a person full of freedom in my heart. The second one I think is determination. I started learning dance when I was 5 years old and am now 31 years old. I have been on stage for 11 years. This persistence stems from my determination for dancers and my dance career. The third one can be said to be faith, because I don’t treat dance as a job, but as a faith. In this way, when you face your dance, face the stage, and face the audience every day, you will feel very happy. status. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;As a dancer, he is well known to the public through Qinglu , you have now become a new face in the public eye. How do you understand this kind of accumulation and the word "new"? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;First of all, I am really lucky, because in fact, we dancers and actors are the same. It is very difficult to find a good role. And dancers are always waiting for good roles. After joining China Oriental Performing Arts Group as a dancer at the age of 20, you will absorb a lot of knowledge. At that time, you want to grow up quickly, gain good experience and mature appearance quickly. When you meet Qinglu at the age of 30, you suddenly slow down because of this character, and slowness is also very determined and powerful. I felt very cherished at that moment, and every day of rehearsal was an immersive encounter with her. ;

;

;The perfect score is not afraid of setbacks

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;How has dance shaped you? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;I think my personality comes from learning dance since I was a child. Since I was 5 years old, I have had to endure physical pain, such as tearing my hips and lowering my waist, so I feel that dance has given me a character that is soft on the outside and strong on the inside. So until now, I don’t think there’s anything that would particularly break me down. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Are you satisfied with your current status? Can it be called a perfect life? How do you define a perfect life or a perfect state? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;I am quite satisfied with every situation. Except for the year when I took the college entrance examination, which was quite stressful, I am quite satisfied with the rest. . It’s not like living a perfect life, because I feel that I am only 31 years old, and I have not returned home with a full score, and I still have to keep running. I think it is a psychological state that cannot be satisfied by any material life conditions. I think it is through an experience. I have experienced many setbacks. When I can face these things calmly, it is a very perfect state. . ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Dance is also a way of expression. Expression is especially important now. Do you think you have been able to express yourself through dance over the years? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;Dancers do not express themselves through themselves, they must be separated from themselves. For example, when I go on stage at 7:00, I will definitely forget the Meng Qingyang in my life. I will definitely put down my phone and forget what takeaway I ate today, which hotel I stayed in today, where I will go to play tomorrow, everything must be forgotten. The moment you actually get on stage, you're rendering this character on a blank sheet of paper. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Will you take photos of the performance now? Do you usually like to take pictures? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;Yes, sometimes the audience will take some photos. I don’t like taking photos. I don’t like taking selfies and checking in at places to take photos. But I will take photos to record through my perspective, not to photograph me. I think (photography) is like this. All the scenes and states you see at the moment are composed through your eyes, just like painting. Everyone may have different viewing angles and moods. I will use my eyes to compose the picture. When I go to take pictures, there is no need for professional composition or anything like that. I just record them casually. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What kind of photos do you think are worthy of the title? A good photo? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang: ;;I think it is a photo with a sense of memory. For example, when flipping through the photo album on your mobile phone, you accidentally turn to this photo, and you will suddenly feel the mood and happiness at that time through this angle and this scene. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;In your opinion, what kind of mentality should you maintain? Can I leave at any time? ;

;

;;Meng Qingyang:;;Don’t be afraid of the setbacks and difficulties you face. Many people say that setbacks and difficulties are good things. I don’t think they are good things, but I think we must first start from our own mentality and not be afraid of these things. When you really do something and it doesn't succeed, just accept its failure. I believe that my next thing will be better. ;

;;

;

;On November 14, 2023 local time, Seoul, South Korea, to prevent Bed bugs are spreading, and railway rolling stock staff in the capital are disinfecting subway facilities to prevent the epidemic. Visual China | Picture

;

;From the perspective of a bug, this is a story about restarting the journey in 2023 after being depressed for three years due to the epidemic.

;

;Beginning in France in August 2023, bed bugs have caused panic in many countries in Europe and Asia. According to Yonhap News Agency's report on November 8, South Korea reported 30 suspected or confirmed bed bug infections, and the government announced the establishment of a joint bed bug response command to declare war on bed bugs.

;

;Bedbugs, also known as bedbugs, are the size of mung beans, have a foul odor, come out at day and night, and specialize in sucking human blood. In the 1960s, it was one of the "four pests" along with flies, mosquitoes, and rats. Later, it disappeared due to the advent of chemical pesticides such as DDT.

;

;As a type of wingless insect that feeds on human blood, bed bugs usually travel long distances with the help of suitcases.

;

;It identifies the host through carbon dioxide, heat signals and human body odor, follows the "human smell" to get into the gaps in the suitcase, and hides in dirty clothes with sweat. . By the time the suitcase is opened again, the bedbugs may have crossed continents.

;

;"I have never been bitten before, and I thought it was allergies. Now I am very scared, and I completely killed it at home." On November 11, Zhang Minru came from South Korea When I returned to Beijing from Seoul, I found traces of bed bug bites on my body. It was only after taking into account recent media reports that I discovered that I had been infected.

;

;On November 8, the Food and Environmental Hygiene Department of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government issued an announcement stating that in order to minimize the chance of bed bugs being introduced into Hong Kong from overseas, it has worked with relevant authorities Departments and agencies have strengthened publicity and education work at different levels and will closely monitor the situation and developments.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters randomly interviewed 11 patients who had suspected or confirmed bed bug bites and found that bed bugs often appear in families with a recent history of business travel. In China, it occurs most frequently in the Pearl River Delta region.

;

;Wang Jianguo, a professor at Jiangxi Agricultural University and technical director of Nanchang Jiangnong Pest Control Co., Ltd., told Southern Weekend reporters that bedbugs did not suddenly break out, but have always existed in society. In the short term, the possibility of widespread epidemic in mainland my country is low, and whether it constitutes a "crisis" remains to be discussed. On November 21, Chongqing Disease Control and Prevention tweeted "Don't panic if bed bugs are active again, correct treatment is key", pointing out that there have been cases of bed bug infestations in Chongqing in recent years.

;

;"Generally speaking, bed bugs do not pose a threat to human safety, but they are a big problem for individuals. After being bitten, the skin is often itchy, and some people will have it. Allergic reactions affect work and life." Wang Jianguo said.

;

;Bed bugs are rampant as tourism recovers

;

;Bed bugs cannot fly, but they can travel with humans around the world.

;

;Wang Changlu, an urban pest control expert and professor of the Department of Entomology at Rutgers University in the United States, told Southern Weekend reporters that since the late 1990s, due to the increase in the international movement of people, prevention and control Due to insufficient investment and resistance to insecticides, bed bugs are re-emerging around the world.

;

;Wang Desen, associate professor at the Department of Entomology, School of Plant Protection, South China Agricultural University, has long been committed to research on bed bug biology and comprehensive prevention and control. He told Southern Weekend reporters that currently bed bugs are responsible for many All types of insecticides have developed significant resistance. The increase in resistance is directly related to the insect's behavioral resistance, resistance gene mutations and body wall thickening. The thickening of the body wall will lead to a weakening of the permeability of the pesticide.

;

;According to the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), Natalie Bangay of the British Pest Control Association said that bed bugs have been a public health problem in the UK for many years. Found across the UK, having seen a decline during Covid due to a lack of global travel, any growth in bed bugs may now simply be a return to normal as people return to free movement.

;

;The British "Guardian" reported that France's national health and hygiene agency Anses found that 11% of French households were plagued by bed bugs between 2017 and 2022. With the 2024 Paris Olympics approaching, the presence of insects suspected to be bedbugs in the Paris subway, trains, cinemas and airports has caused concern.

;

;Many entomology experts told Southern Weekend reporters that bed bugs most often appear in places with dense crowds, high population mobility, and untidy environments, such as dormitories. , train carriages, massage chairs at high-speed rail stations, and movie theaters.

;

;Thigtaxis and phototaxis require bed bugs to settle in a dark environment where their bodies are surrounded by four sides, so bed bugs usually hibernate in small dark places. After having the opportunity to feed on the host's blood, the flat body will swell into a ball. They have a pair of stink glands on their bodies that release a foul-smelling fluid when frightened - hence the name bedbugs.

;

;;

;

;Symptoms of human body being bitten by bed bugs. Wang Desen | Photo

;

;A few people with severe allergies will suffer from anaphylactic shock

;

;Another name for bed bugs is bed bugs. After entering the home environment , they will climb up mattresses, sofas and other human resting places along the legs of furniture. If the furniture is against the wall, they will also climb onto the furniture from gaps in the wall. Although this active dispersal distance is very short - a study published in PLOS ONE ("Public Library of Science: General") found that bed bugs actively dispersal distances are only a few meters to tens of meters.

;

;Zhang Wei, who lives in the United States, told Southern Weekend reporters that when the bed bugs were at their worst, she used a flashlight to look for them bit by bit in the middle of the night. , "It will appear anywhere, including in clothes, on the bed, stuffed toys, walls, toilets... Its larvae are very small, as small as a needle tip, and will occasionally crawl across your phone screen. Sometimes they are found on the bed It’s something like a fat particle.”

;

;Wang Desen told Southern Weekend reporters that after being bitten and sucked by bedbugs, the human body will experience a lot of discomfort. For example, erythematous papules or blisters may appear at the bite site, and skin damage and secondary infection may occur due to scratching. In severe cases, anaphylactic shock may occur and be life-threatening. Because bed bugs hide and only appear at night, they are more difficult to catch than mosquitoes. Long-term bed bug infestation can cause symptoms such as insomnia, anxiety, neurasthenia, and mental depression. Although there have been no reports of bed bugs transmitting diseases, a large number of studies have shown that a variety of pathogens related to human diseases can be detected in bed bugs, so the bugs are still a potentially important vector of human diseases.

;

;A citizen who lives in Hong Kong encountered bed bugs two years ago. He described the state of being bitten like this: "Every night, I was so itchy that I couldn't sleep. I was bitten by one. My mood explodes every week. The wound will be very itchy and painful when exposed to hot water."

;

;It should be pointed out that it is impossible to judge whether the bite is serious or not just from the traces of the bite. From bedbugs. Natalie Bongay also said in an interview with the BBC that the media or public's focus on bed bugs often leads to false alarms.

;

;Wang Desen found during the survey that many residents easily confuse bed bugs with cockroaches, fleas, lice, ticks and mites, and some residents think bed bugs and mosquitoes , flies have the same ability to fly.

;

;Factory dormitories and group rentals are high-incidence areas

;

;Bed bugs belong to the family Hemiptera, among which the temperate and tropical bed bugs are more prevalent. Bed bugs are closely related to humans.

;

;The largest bed bug survey in China is currently conducted by Deng Guofan of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and Feng Lanzhou of the Chinese Union Medical College. Deng and Feng collected 81 bed bugs in China between 1950 and 1951. Bedbug specimens from various regions were collected, and the research results "Geographical Distribution of Temperate and Tropical Bedbugs Cimex lectularius L., Cimex hemiptera F. in China" were published in 1953.

;

;The above studies show that both temperate bed bugs and tropical bed bugs are found in China. Tropical bed bugs are mainly distributed in Guangdong and Guangxi provinces, while temperate bed bugs are found in East and North China. It commonly occurs in the provinces of , northeast and northwest, and is also distributed in Xiamen, Fujian, Qujiang, Guangdong (belonging to Shaoguan City), Guilin, Guangxi, Mengzi, Yunnan, Guiyang, Guizhou and other places.

;

;Wang Jianguo introduced that bed bugs prevalent around the world usually refer to temperate bed bugs. In China, temperate bed bugs are distributed in the Yangtze and Yellow River basins, but are also found in South China and are a cosmopolitan species; tropical bed bugs are distributed in South China, Taiwan and tropical areas. Wang Desen believes that with the changes in the indoor environment caused by climate warming and the use of northern heating, tropical bed bugs may also appear in temperate areas.

;

;;

;

;Temperate bed bug adults and tropical bed bug adults. Photo by Wang Desen |

;

;Southern Weekend reporters searched for domestic patients bitten by bed bugs on social platforms and found that most of the patients who shared suspected or confirmed bed bug encounters on the Internet were concentrated in Zhuhai. The triangle area is consistent with some domestic research conclusions.

;

;Wang Changlu and other researchers published a study on bed bug infestation in Shenzhen in 2013 and found that bed bugs were infested among migrant workers in Dongguan and Shenzhen industrial zones. Dormitories are the worst affected, with an average positivity rate of 52.1%.

;

;Wang Desen conducted an investigation on the harm and prevention of bed bugs in some areas of Guangdong Province from 2017 to 2019, and found that Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Dongguan, Foshan, Guangzhou, etc. Bedbugs appear everywhere, and factory dormitories and group rental housing with densely populated people, high mobility, and poor sanitary conditions are high-incidence areas.

;

;"We visited factory dormitories and found that many factories are infested with bed bugs. The movement of employees back and forth between different factory areas can easily cause the spread of bed bugs." Wang Desen said.

;

;Avoid prevention and control misunderstandings and recommend non-chemical methods

;

;Although bed bugs are unlikely to pose a "crisis" that threatens human health at this stage, patients " The experience of being bitten with hundreds of red bumps all over the body proves that it still has the power to make people suffer, and it is necessary to take scientific prevention and treatment measures.

;

;Bed bug prevention and control includes physical control, chemical control, comprehensive control and other means. For ordinary households, it is recommended to use a comprehensive prevention and control method that focuses on physical control and supplements chemical control.

;

;Physical control refers to the use of heat treatment, inorganic powders, bed bug interception devices, etc. to prevent and control bed bugs. Since bed bugs are very sensitive to high temperatures, residents can treat bed bug-infested furniture and items by frequently washing and drying bedding and clothing with hot water, and using a hot steam machine (such as a garment steamer). After heat treatment, when the air humidity is reduced, spraying inorganic powder represented by diatomaceous earth in the corners of walls, seams of bed frames, under mattresses and other areas where bed bugs often move can also effectively kill bed bugs.

;

;;

;

;Bed bug hiding spots. Photo by Wang Desen |

;

;It should be pointed out that a common misunderstanding in preventing bed bugs is to expose the furniture where bed bugs are found to the sun. Since the temperature of sun exposure cannot instantly reach the lethal temperature of bed bugs (50°C), it may cause bed bugs to spread to other uninfested places, especially in apartments or residential buildings with many rooms.

;

;"Generally, it is not recommended to use chemical agents, because the common pyrethroid insecticides on the market are toxic and should not be used by families with pets and children. It is not recommended to use it. If you need to use it, you should strictly follow the recommended dosage of the drug, and do not use it on sofas, beds and other places that are in direct contact with the human body." Wang Changlu said.

;

;For people who frequently travel for business and tourism, Wang Desen recommends always keeping mosquito repellent water sprayed on the suitcase, and promptly checking and cleaning the suitcase and the clothes inside it after returning home to avoid Bringing bed bugs into your home.

;

;In densely populated communities, once a bed bug outbreak occurs, all residences in the entire community are at risk of being infested. Therefore, community-wide treatment should be considered during bed bug control. Wang Desen pointed out that after removing bed bugs, it is also necessary to establish a long-term awareness of prevention. You can regularly check the corners of the bed, wall gaps, etc. through visual inspection to determine whether there are traces of bed bug activity, molting or feces; in addition, you can also use traps placed under the bed for long-term monitoring.

;

;For crowded places such as hotels, schools, unit dormitories, etc., Wang Jianguo suggested asking PCO (Pest Control) companies to conduct professional monitoring and thorough disinfecting.

;

;"It is difficult to completely 'eliminate' a pest. We can only reduce its population as much as possible on a local scale and prevent it from spreading. Cause great harm. After getting rid of the "four pests" for so long, humans are still fighting against them. But as long as people increase their awareness of bed bug prevention and control, they can avoid large-scale outbreaks of bed bugs. Bed bugs are no longer very common nowadays. It may become a serious pest like cockroaches, flies and mosquitoes," Wang Jianguo said.

; Fri, 24 Nov 2023 09:25:03 +0800 陆仙人：从乡村地头走到巴黎时装周http://www.infzm.com/contents/261166

;

;;

;

;; (Picture from Honor 100 series Photography/picture);

;

;In March 2023, Lu Xianren appeared for the first time on the Paris Fashion Week show. He was invited to walk the show, wearing a black silhouette suit, white trousers and a neat hairstyle. He was one of the few non-scientific models present, and his starting point on the catwalk was on a rural road in Guangxi.

;

;In 2019, Lu Xianren, who was working in Guangdong, quit his job and returned to his hometown in Guangxi to shoot short videos full-time. He always wanted to be a model, so most of the photos he took were of him walking in shows. The clothing is all homemade, made from woven bags, blankets, waterproof plastic sheets, old lampshades, branches, leaves... match the upper body and walk in the mountains.

;

;He worked hard for more than a month, but the account was not as popular as he imagined. It was already summer, and the sultry weather also affected his mood: Was he unable to achieve results no matter what? It's better to be more casual and show yourself. So in the high temperature, he put on the red blanket at home as clothes and walked barefoot for a while. This random move immediately brought about a heat stroke and high fever, but it also brought a huge number of likes. Lu Xianren woke up from his sleep and saw the number of likes on the video rising, and even doubted the authenticity of the matter.

;

;In the end, this video became popular on the platform, with more than 2 million likes. He's on fire.

;

;The short video era gives everyone the opportunity to experience the "15 minutes of fame". It has become easy for ordinary people to produce a popular video. In the ocean of traffic, there will always be a point where you can Hit a group of people. However, it is not easy to make this flow sustainable. But Lu Xianren did not hesitate. When he decided to shoot short videos full-time, he had already conceived many ideas. So if it wasn’t because of the red blanket that it became popular, would it also be because of other creative ideas? Lu Xianren laughed at this: "Not necessarily." He still showed a cautious attitude towards his fame.

;

;Lu Xianren, whose real name is Lu Kaigang, was born in Heng County, Guangxi in 1999. His parents worked outside all year round, and he was raised by his grandparents. When he was in fifth grade, he saw a modeling competition on TV and was attracted by the models' aura and outfits. It became his dream to walk on the catwalk. From then on, when he got home from school, he would take time to practice Tai step. He was originally a little hunched, but after practicing he opened his shoulders and held his head high. When practicing, hold a book on your head. "The book cannot go away, so the steps are formed."

;

;After three months, the book is firmly on the head. "But what I learned more is their confidence on the stage and the way they want to express themselves on the stage." Today's Lu Xianren said.

;

;After dropping out of middle school, Lu Kaigang went to Guangdong to work. He worked as an apprentice in a barber shop and a restaurant, and then worked in a factory. He used his spare time to continue his modeling studies. He recorded videos and compared them with professional models' pace, down to the time to keep his head and the number of seconds to pause when positioning.

;

;In 2018, he started shooting his own videos. When choosing the nickname for his account, he thought of his home in the mountains. Every day when he got up, he could see the mist outside the window. It was "very fairy", so he named himself "Lu Xianren".

;

;A year later, he decided to quit his job and return to his hometown to shoot short videos full-time. "Give yourself half a year, and if it doesn't work, go back and work honestly." Hence the subsequent story. After that, his creative juices flowed and his modeling career got on the right track.

;

;Lu Xianren is 180 centimeters tall and wears women's clothing in most of the videos. This time it was not understood. Some relatives saw the video and ran to ask Lu Xianren's family: "Why is your child like this?" Grandma said: Young people have their own ideas, and they must have their own reasons for what they do, so just leave them alone.

;

;;

;

;;(Photo taken by Honor 100 series);

;

;My current life is not It counts as a full score, but try to go in the direction of full score

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;2023 3 In March, you participated in the Paris Fashion Week catwalk for the first time. You are a new face in the international fashion world. What new characteristics do you think you have? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren:;;The fashion industry has never lacked new faces. On the international stage, I have been recognized by more people, and the global fashion media have discovered me. A new face, discovering maybe a new strength. Mainly, I (this type) are relatively rare in the fashion industry, and I personally feel more special. And "new" represents a new force, the ability to move forward, and an opportunity. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;catwalk on the international stage and in the countryside What's the difference? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren:;;I personally think it is a change in mentality. At the beginning, when I walked the show on rural trails and country roads, I was just enjoying the scenery, which I thought was beautiful. After going to Paris Fashion Week, I felt a little nervous for the first time. I slowly adapted and enjoyed it. I slowly began to interact with the audience and resonate with the designers. I seemed to have a passion for their clothes and their love. Perception, there is a spiritual connection. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;The show left in your mind What is the first screen? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren:;;At the final curtain call, the audience waved to the designer and then applauded. I have walked in so many shows, some of which were applauded by the audience, and some of which the audience left immediately after the show. In that show, most of them stood up and applauded. They must have found something they like and resonated with. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;The way you appear in the camera is very professional , what kind of training have you received for this? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren: ;;While visiting the scene, I observed some photography teachers. In what state did they take photos? I think taking pictures has something to do with the state. I don’t like to pose in a pose for taking pictures, or to set up a big scene for taking pictures. ;

;

;I personally take photos more casually. When I encounter good scenery or beautiful things, I will take pictures and record them. I bought a smartphone in 2016. At that time, I was still taking pictures of landscapes, but I didn’t dare to take pictures of myself, and I wasn’t very confident yet.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What do you think a good photo should look like? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren: ;;The first thing is to attract attention, and then have a sense of story and impact. I may not pay much attention to a certain detail in the whole photo, but I will pay attention to the general appearance. A photo cannot be 100% perfect, 98% or 95% perfect, and this photo may be remembered for a long time. I don’t really like to make perfect photos. When I photoshop, I will keep my flaws and spots. I am still satisfied with myself and pay more attention to the quality of the photos. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Do you have any suggestions for everyone to take photos? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren:;;If you are not particularly confident, then you don’t have to look at the camera all the time. The camera is not that important. Taking photos is to record what is happening at the moment. When you are not looking at the camera, you can fully show your relaxed state. ;

;

;My confidence comes from my love for the lens, plus I like taking pictures - the feeling of the camera clicking out. The moment the camera presses the shutter button, it records the present moment. I think it is a very magical thing. Nowadays, everyone can take a camera and take pictures at any time. When I take pictures, I don’t necessarily mean what kind of pictures I will take. When I take pictures, I record what I want to do at the moment. When you look at it later, you will know that you were quite happy at that time.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;How would you rate your current life? ;

;

;;Lu Xianren:;;I think the ideal full-scoring life is half life and half the work. But I think it doesn’t have to be perfect to have a perfect life, it depends on the pace of life. For example, I may have been very busy some time ago. After finishing my work, I went home to take a rest, spend time with my grandma, and look for new inspiration. Life and work need to coordinate with each other. My current life is not perfect, but I will try my best to move towards it. ;
